action.action-desc: Ms. Barragán introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

form.official-title: To amend title 39, United States Code, to provide that care packages mailed to a member of the Armed Forces by any family member shall be carried at no cost to the family member, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Military Care Package Program Act.

section.header: No-cost mailing of care packages to members of the Armed Forces

subsection.text: Chapter 34 of title 39, United States Code, is amended by inserting after section 3401 the following new section:

section.header: Mailing privileges of family members of members of Armed Forces of the United States

subsection.text: A military care package shall be carried at no cost to the sender if the package—

paragraph.text: is mailed to an individual who is a member of the Armed Forces deployed in support of a contingency operation;
is mailed by a family member of such individual; and
is addressed to a postal facility located at an Armed Forces installation.

subsection.text: The Department of Defense shall reimburse the Postal Service for carrying out this section consistent, to the greatest extent practicable, with the requirements of the second sentence of subsection (c) and subsection (e) of section 3401.
This section shall be administered under such conditions, and under such regulations, as the Postal Service and the Secretary of Defense jointly may prescribe.

paragraph.text: the term contingency operation has the meaning given that term in section 101(a)(13) of title 10; and
the term family member means a parent, sibling, spouse, or child of an individual who is a member of the Armed Forces.

subsection.text: The table of sections for such chapter is amended by inserting after the item relating to section 3401 the following new item:

toc.toc-entry: 3402. Mailing privileges of family members of members of Armed Forces of the United States.
